Ganga Kondachola

Rajendra I continued the expansionist policies of his father Rajaraja. He conquered the whole of Sri Lanka. His most famous conquest was the Ganga Campaign, where his army defeated the Pala king Mahipala of Kalinga and Bengal and brought back Ganga water. In commemoration of this victory, he founded the city of 'Gangaikonda Cholapuram' and assumed the title 'Gangaikonda'.

ЁЯЪв
Srivijaya Expedition

His navy attacked the Srivijaya Empire (Kadaram) in Southeast Asia (modern Indonesia and Malaysia). This was the boldest expedition in Indian maritime history, aimed at securing trade routes with China.
